Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

Artefact is a leading global consulting company dedicated to accelerating the adoption of data and AI to positively impact people and organizations. We specialize in data & AI transformation and data marketing to drive tangible business results across the entire enterprise value chain.




Artefact offers the most comprehensive set of data-driven solutions per industry, built on deep data science and cutting-edge AI technologies, delivering AI projects at scale in all industry sectors. From strategy to operations, we offer an end-to-end approach and solutions: data strategy, data quality and governance, data platforms, AI Factory, data-driven customer experience and marketing ROI. Our 1500+ employees operate in 22 countries (Europe, Asia, Americas, Middle East, Africa) and we partner with 1000+ clients, including some of the world’s top 300 brands such as Samsung, L’Oréal, and Sanofi.




Do you want to be at the forefront of helping clients on their digital and data journeys while positioning Artefact as a leader in innovation? Join our forward-thinking team in a rapidly growing environment with ample career advancement opportunities. If you're passionate about technology and data, this is your chance to make an impact!




What You Will Be Doing:

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in supporting clients across different industries in their data-driven transformations. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:




Working on exciting data science projects: You will help develop and implement data science solutions that transform clients’ businesses. These include projects in Causal Inference, GenAI (especially using open-source & open-weight LLMs), Forecasting and Optimisation
Collaborating across teams: Work with our creative, strategy, and activation teams to deliver comprehensive services.
Building client relationships: Use your technical skills to help clients enhance their marketing efforts and data strategies.
International exposure: You’ll have opportunities to work on projects with global teams, gaining valuable experience across different markets such as the US, France, Sweden & the UK.




You will also:

Ensure successful and timely delivery of your data Science & ML projects.
Keep your team updated on progress and share achievements.
Work closely with consultants to understand clients' needs and create impactful data science solutions.
Ensure your solutions provide real value to clients and their goals.
Be a strong team player and contribute to shared objectives.




What We Are Looking For

We’re seeking someone who has:




Educational Background: A completed Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, machine learning, mathematics, or related subjects).
Hands-On Experience: Some experience (e.g., internships or working student roles) in data engineering, analytics, or consulting, preferably in a marketing or digital context is considered a plus.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of computer science fundamentals, data processing, algorithms, and data architecture. Experience with tools like Python and SQL is a plus.
Analytical Mindset: A love for working with data to find actionable insights and solve problems.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, comfortable discussing technical and non-technical topics with clients and team members.
Curiosity and Passion: A genuine interest in learning and exploring new technologies and tools in data and AI.




Why You Should Join Us:




Learning and Development: Join a team of passionate Data Scientists and ML Engineers who will support your growth and provide ample learning opportunities.
Culture of Celebration: We pride ourselves on creating a collaborative and fun work environment with regular team events and activities.
Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including a competitive salary, phone & travel reimbursements, remote work allowance, and a Onefit membership discount.
Work-Life Balance: We offer flexibility with a hybrid working environment that lets you balance personal and professional commitments.
Fuel Your Day: Enjoy a healthy and delicious daily lunch from our extensive organic buffet.
Weekly Unwind: Take advantage of our weekly massage sessions to de-stress and relax.
Centrally Located: Our Utrecht office is conveniently situated near the station for easy commuting.
Career Growth Opportunities: We’re committed to your professional development, offering continuous learning and internal promotion opportunities.




Join Us Now and Be Part of the Future:

Artefact is experiencing exciting growth, and this is the perfect time to join our dynamic team and contribute to our success story.

Come join us!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hi, we’re Fever

We’re excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

Behind the user-friendly iOS and Android apps and webpage that work across the world is the engineering team. We are in charge of creating, developing, improving, and maintaining all Fever services so that more people can have an amazing experience.

About the role


You'll help shape how data science is done at Fever. You'll be responsible for creating and maintaining an end to end machine learning pipeline.
You'll work hand in hand with data scientists and data engineers helping on the experiment setup and model design.
You'll bring to production models that will have a direct impact on the end user experience.
You'll enforce best practices in data usage and model building.


On your first month in Fever:


You will be fully integrated into the team. During this month you will have already participated in onboarding, you'll get a deep dive in the current machine learning efforts and you will have met the different departments at Fever.
You'll get familiar with Fever's tech stack and frameworks.
You will attend some of the Fever Original’s experiences like Candlelight


After 3 months in Fever:


You’ll be able to come up with solutions to new difficult problems and you'll be generating impact and creating new business opportunities.
You’ll have responsibilities and ownership over parts of our modeling pipeline or other critical tools.
You will mostly know everybody from the data and engineering communities.


On your 6th month in Fever:


You’ll have deployed to production models that have a direct impact on user experience.
You'll be able to identify gaps in our platforms and processes and be a champion for continuous improvement
You’ll be mentoring other new joiners to the team
You will participate in some of the team buildings we organise for your team or the whole engineering team


Key responsibilities


Deploy trusted models that power Fever's decision making
Design, build and support modern and scalable machine learning infrastructure, e.g.
Build a reproducible, organized, end to end machine learning pipeline.
Build model quality and usage monitoring systems.
Automate model training.
Build tools to make our business processes more efficient.
Understand the technical trade offs of different solutions, implement them and make them scalable

About you


You’re smart, get stuff done, have great energy, and thrive in a fast paced environment
You have experience building reproducible, production-ready machine learning pipelines
You have experience productionizing models
You are familiar with the engineering best practices, creating quality code
You're an expert in Python3 and its data ecosystem
Experience with AWS (S3, EC2, …)
You have experience in Docker
You are proficient in business English


It would be a plus if you...


You have worked Kubernetes, you've deployed services with EKS
Have experience with SageMaker, MLFlow or similar frameworks.
You have worked with Django, FastAPI or other python web frameworks.
You have worked with Airflow or similar tools.
You have worked in a multidisciplinary team working with roles such as data analysts, data scientists, marketing or product managers.
You are familiar with tools and processes for reproducible, production-ready ML applications (e.g. data logging, ML workflows, model serving).
You have worked with the API of the most popular marketing tools (Facebook, Google, Instagram, etc.)
You have built data-powered tools either in a professional setting or as passion projects.


Benefits & Perks


Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance.
Stock options.
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Home office friendly, location in Madrid or Barcelona required
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee.
English Lessons
Gympass Membership
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow.


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in document analysis, leveraging LLMs (Large Language Models) and rule-based algorithms to extract, process, and analyze structured and unstructured data. You will work on cutting-edge solutions involving Azure Document Intelligence, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Knowledge Graphs, helping to drive innovation in document automation.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize document analysis applications using LLMs and rule-based techniques.
Process and extract data from PDF, Excel, and Word files.
Implement RAG pipelines to enhance retrieval and reasoning capabilities.
Utilize Azure Document Intelligence for document automation.
Design and maintain Knowledge Graphs for structured data representation.
Build and optimize REST APIs for document processing applications.
Ensure strong coding practices and scalable software development in Python.
Work with SQL databases to store and manage extracted information.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings effectively.

Core Skills & Qualifications

Python (strong programming experience)
SQL & general database knowledge
Experience handling PDF, Excel, and Word files
Familiarity with LLM APIs (OpenAI, etc.)
Expertise in Azure Document Intelligence
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Knowledge Graphs for structured data modeling
Experience with REST APIs & software development
Strong analytical and communication skills

Nice-to-Have Skills

Databricks experience
Understanding of insurance and cyber topics

Show more

Title: R&D Data Scientist - CDI
HTML:
ABOUT DESCARTES UNDERWRITING

Descartes was born out of the conviction that the ever-increasing complexity of risks faced by corporations, governments and vulnerable communities calls for a renewed approach in insurance.

Our team brings together industry veterans from the most renowned institutions (AXA, SCOR, Swiss Re, Marsh, Aon, ...) and scientists on top of their field to bring underwriting excellence. After 6 years of existence, Descartes has secured a leading position in parametric insurance for weather and climate-related risks utilizing machine learning, real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT.

After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, we launched Descartes Insurance, a 'full stack' insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French regulator ACPR. With a growing corporate client base (400+ and counting), our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 17 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. Descartes is trusted by a panel of A-rated (re)insurers to carry out its activities.



ABOUT YOUR ROLE

Descartes Underwriting is seeking a R&D Data Scientist to join our R&D Department.


In the Descartes Underwriting R&D department, there are two teams responsible for modelling climate risks: one team in charge of atmospheric perils and the second team is in charge of land based perils like wildfire and flood.

This opening is in the Surface hazards team.


You will report directly to the R&D Manager.


Your responsibilities would include :

  • Conduct research on the modeling of climate risks and machine learning methods;
  • Identify new and innovative ideas and testing state-of-the-art methods based on recent research articles;
  • Collaborate with the underwriting and business teams to ensure our products are efficiently integrated into the underwriting process and meet our clients’ needs;
  • Propose model developments or features that are technically and economically aligned with company’s strategy;
  • Take part and help in new products/existing models, translating and combining multiple research ideas and solutions into a new product or module.


ABOUT YOU

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Scientific academic background with a research-oriented Master’s Degree or PhD in meteorological studies, climate science, physics or applied mathematics;
  • From 3 to 5 years of experience in R&D (PhD included);
  • Strong skills in statistics, applied mathematics, physics and machine learning methods;
  • Proven track record of significant individual contributor roles for solving complex problems;
  • Ideally a previous experience in climate modeling or data science.

SKILLS

  • Proficiency in Python (scikit learn, ...);
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) is required;
  • Good command of one additional language (e.g. Chinese, French, Italian, German, Spanish...) is valued.

MINDSET

  • Interested in weather and natural perils modeling (cyclones, wildfires, flood, hail, tsunamis, earthquakes, etc);
  • Strong team spirit and ability to work under pressure;
  • Eagerness to solve complex problems and technical challenges;
  • Rigorous, creative and meticulous mind;
  • Strong desire to learn and commitment to the organization’s mission;
  • Results oriented, high energy, with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment;
  • Motivated to help improving businesses’ and communities’ resilience to climate change.



WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING ?

  • Opportunity to work and learn with teams from the most prestigious schools and research labs in the world, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;
  • Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.) ;
  • Work in a collaborative & professional environment ;
  • Be part of an international team, passionate about diversity ;
  • Join a company with a true purpose – help us help our clients be more resilient towards climate risks;
  • A competitive salary, bonus and benefits;
  • You can benefit from a punctual home office days.


At Descartes Underwriting, we cherish value of diversity whatever it may be. We are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.

With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.



RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • Step 1: HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter
  • Step 2: Technical online test
  • Step 3: Remote technical interview with a R&D Data Scientist
  • Step 4: In-person team interview to meet our R&D Data Scientist team and discover our offices (held remotely if you are abroad)

Title: IA Engineer /Data Scientist Senior (GenIA, NLP)
Description:
Elegir Capgemini es elegir la posibilidad de dar forma a tu carrera profesional como desees. Recibirás el apoyo y la inspiración de una comunidad colaborativa de colegas de todo el mundo y podrás reinventar lo que es posible. Únete a nuestro equipo y ayuda a las principales organizaciones del mundo a descubrir el valor de la tecnología y a construir un mundo más sostenible e inclusivo.

¿Te apetece sumarte a nosotros y participar en proyectos multisectoriales en un equipo conformado por profesionales del dato como Data Scientists, Data Engineers o Data Analysts? Nuestro objetivo es ayudar a nuestros clientes en el camino hacia la innovación continua.




¿Qué harás en el proyecto? ¿Cuál será tu rol?




Estamos buscando un/a Ingeniero/a de IA y Científico de Datos para unirse a nuestro equipo. El/la candidato/a ideal tendrá una sólida experiencia en Procesamiento del Lenguaje Natural (NLP) y en el desarrollo de modelos de IA generativa. Además, deberá poseer un alto nivel de inglés, tanto escrito como hablado, para colaborar eficazmente con equipos internacionales.

Tu misión será liderar, impulsar y desarrollar técnicamente con autonomía iniciativas en el ámbito de la IA generativa y ML y también:




Diseñarás, desarrollarás y realizarás el despliegue de soluciones usando modelos de Machine Learning , Deep Learning y Computer Vision.
Desarrollarás proyectos con NLP y LLMs.
Gestionarás y manipularás conjuntos de datos: Definición e identificación de variables de aprendizaje, generación de nuevos conjuntos, realización de transformaciones y limpieza .Definirás procesos de Aprendizaje Automático End-to-End.
Desarrollarás procesos de entrenamiento mediante diferentes tipos de frameworks (TF, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc).
Desarrollarás procesos de inferencia en entornos On-premise o Cloud.
Realizarás el mantenimiento de modelos existentes de Aprendizaje Automático.
Liderarás equipos técnicos de proyecto.
Realizarás la mentorización de Data Scientists Junior o en formación.
Participarás en propuestas técnicas a nivel nacional e internacional.




Para desenvolverte bien en la posición se requieren conocimientos en/de:




Es necesario que aportes Grado en Informática, Matemáticas, Física o Ingenierías similar y puedas desenvolverte bien con:
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos en el entorno de la IA generativa trabajando con NLP, LLMs,
Experiencia contrastada de más de 3 años en proyectos aplicando técnicas de ML y DL en entornos productivos.
Experiencia en la implementación de soluciones de IA en entornos de producción.
Conocimientos de DevOps y MLOps.
Experiencia en la definición, creación, despliegue y mantenimiento de modelos de ML y DL sobre entornos productivos.
Conocimiento sobre Python y/o R en el ámbito de la ciencia de datos.
Conocimiento Databricks.
Conocimientos avanzados sobre frameworks de Aprendizaje Automático (TF, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc).
Conocimientos avanzados sobre servicios analíticos cloud sobre AWS, GCP o Azure.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo de manera efectiva.
Proactividad a la hora de construir soluciones y aplicar nuevas funcionalidades relacionadas con la tecnología en uso.
Además, sería genial si tienes:
PhD o Máster en ciencias de computación, ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial, matemáticas o estadística.
Conocimientos avanzados sobre Apache Spark en el ámbito de la ciencia de datos (PySpark).
Conocimiento sobre Docker y/o Kubernetes.
Conocimiento sobre herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI o similares).
Certificaciones en AWS, GCP o Azure (u otras plataformas cloud equivalentes para el tratamiento de datos).
Experiencia desarrollando y utilizando aplicaciones de tipo SaaS.
Conocimiento y aplicación de la ciencia de datos en diferentes sectores e industrias: banca, seguros, telco, retail, etc.




Se valorará positivamente el poseer certificado de discapacidad, en el marco de nuestra política de inclusión y diversidad.

Valoraremos todas las candidaturas. Contamos con una amplísima oferta formativa, presencial, online de Certificaciones, etc. Aunque no tengas el 100% de los conocimientos valorados ¡nos encantará conocerte!

Nuestro compromiso con la inclusión e igualdad de oportunidades hace que tengamos un Plan de Igualdad y un Código Ético que garantizan el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección dentro de un entorno libre de discriminación por cuestión de etnia, nacionalidad, origen social, edad, orientación sexual, expresión de género, religión o cualquier otra circunstancia personal, física o social.




¿Qué te gustará de trabajar aquí?

Tenemos un catálogo de medidas de Desarrollo y Conciliación muy completo, como son, por ejemplo:

• Un ambiente de trabajo único muy valorado por nuestros profesionales en las evaluaciones periódicas.

• Wellbeing HUB - Incluye políticas y acciones para la salud física (Wellhub) y mental.

• 24 días de vacaciones + 2 asuntos propios + 24 y 31 de diciembre + opción a comprar hasta 7 días de vacaciones al año.

• FlexAbroad: posibilidad de trabajar en remoto desde otro país durante 45 días.

• Plan de Compensación Flexible (seguro médico, transporte, formación, tarjeta restaurante o subvención de comida, guardería…)

• Formación continua, podrás disfrutar de Mylearning y de Capgemini University y de nuestros Campus Digitales y Comunidades profesionales. Tendrás acceso a plataformas como: Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, Harvard Manager Mentor, Education First para idiomas (inglés francés, alemán…) ¡entre otras!

• Participación en Acciones de Voluntariado y Acción Social con nuestros Grupos de Sostenibilidad, Inclusión e Igualdad.

• Acompañamiento en tus inicios con el programa de Buddies.

• Seguro de Vida y Accidentes




¿Por qué Capgemini?

Capgemini es líder global en transformando los negocios de los clientes aprovechando todo el poder de la tecnología. Nos guía el propósito de lograr un futuro inclusivo y sostenible a través de la tecnología y de la energía de quienes la desarrollamos. Somos una compañía responsable y diversa, líder internacional en servicios de IT e Ingeniería con más de 360.000 profesionales en más de 50 países. Con una sólida herencia de 55 años y una amplia experiencia en la industria, los clientes confían en Capgemini para abordar la totalidad de sus necesidades comerciales, desde la estrategia y el diseño hasta las operaciones, impulsadas por el rápido y novedoso mundo de la nube, los datos, la IA, la conectividad, el software, las plataformas e ingeniería digitales. El Grupo reportó en 2022 ingresos globales de €22 mil millones.

Reescribe tu futuro. ¡Únete al equipo!

www.capgemini.com/es-es

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation? Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.

Join Reply!




WHAT WE OFFER

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.




WHAT WE NEED

Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.




WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.

Feel interested?

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a Data Scientist with a strong background in building document analysis applications using LLMs (OpenAI API) and/or rule-based methods. You'll leverage Python, SQL, handle various document formats, implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs, work with Azure Document Intelligence, and develop REST APIs. Strong coding and communication skills are essential.




Job Description:-

Responsibilities:

Develop document analysis applications using LLMs and/or rules.
Process PDF, Excel, Word files; implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs.
Utilize OpenAI API and Azure Document Intelligence.
Build REST APIs and Python applications with strong coding practices.
Collaborate and communicate effectively.

Qualifications:

Strong Python and SQL skills.
Experience with LLMs (OpenAI API), RAG, and document handling.
Software development experience with REST APIs.
Good communication skills.

Nice to Have: Databricks, insurance/cyber knowledge.




About Us:

Ascendion is a global, leading provider of AI-first software engineering services, delivering transformative solutions across North America, APAC, and Europe. We are headquartered in New Jersey. We combine technology and talent to deliver tech debt relief, improve engineering productivity solutions, and accelerate time to value, driving our clients’ digital journeys with efficiency and velocity. Guided by our “Engineering to the power of AI” [EngineeringAI] methodology, we integrate AI into software engineering, enterprise operations, and talent orchestration, to address critical challenges of trust, speed, and capital. For more information, please go to www.ascendion.com




With Ascendion (www.ascendion.com), you:

Will get to work on numerous challenging and exciting projects on our various offerings including Salesforce, AI/Data Science, Generative AI/ML, Automation, Cloud Enterprise and Product/Platform Engineering.
At Ascendion you have high chances of project extension or redeployment to other clients.
Additionally, you can also share CV of anyone you know. We have a referral policy in place.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us




Themisphere is a fast-growing early-stage startup on a mission to transform how real estate data is processed and understood. We are pioneering the field of AI-powered solutions enabling real estate professionals to automate complex workflows, streamline data inflows, and enhance decision-making. Our software suite leverages cutting-edge LLMs and NLP pipelines to classify complex real estate data and seamlessly extract critical data points while delivering advanced analysis and performing complex calculations with unparalleled accuracy and scale.




About this role




As LLM / NLP Engineer at Themisphere, you will contribute to the technical charge in building and refining the core models that power our products. You'll work closely with the founders, the Head of AI and the product team to architect end-to-end machine learning solutions, from preprocessing raw documents to training domain-specific LLMs. This is a unique opportunity to shape a greenfield product and influence the technology roadmap of our evolving software portfolio.


Tasks



Develop and fine-tune LLM-based NLP models for document classification and information extraction.


Implement OCR, embeddings, NER, Encoder Only Classification and semantic search techniques to handle a wide range of document formats.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate user feedback and iteratively improve accuracy and performance.


Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the latest NLP and LLM research and apply best practices to our pipelines.



Requirements



Technical background: 2+ years hands-on experience in NLP, including working with transformer-based models (e.g., BERT, GPT-4, LLaMa, ...).


Tooling & tech stack: proficiency in Python, PyTorch and efficiency tools.


Passionate about tech and AI, actively engaged in the community.


Problem-solving: strong analytical skills and the ability to break down complex problems into data-driven solutions.


Adaptability: enthusiasm for working in a dynamic startup environment where priorities can shift.


Collaboration: excellent communication and teamwork skills, comfortable working closely with product managers, annotators, and other engineers.





Why join us?





Have a direct impact on shaping the company's core product and technology direction.


Work with a team of passionate engineers and seasoned entrepreneurs on an industry-changing mission.


Possibility to grow into a leadership role, since you will be the backbone of the system built.


A lively, open and entrepreneurial culture with flat hierarchies, fast decision-making and efficient communication channels.





If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of NLP and applying LLM technology to transform the largest asset class in the world, we'd love to hear from you.




How to apply:




Please send your resume, LinkedIn and/or X profile, any relevant project links and GitHub repos via Join.com.




Let's shape the future of real estate with transformative technology together!




The minimum salary for this position is according to the IT collective agreement (EUR 3.724 gross monthly salary for full-time employment). Your entry level and starting salary will be based on your qualification and experience.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Stott and May are currently partnered with a ground-breaking organisation based in Paderborn that are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with a strong academic background to join the expanding team. This company are at the forefront of their field and have grown between 15% - 20% in the last 12 months!




As a Machine Learning Engineer, you must have the following experience:

Experience developing ML models – implementing neural networks.
Experience with ML frameworks including TensorFlow, PyTorch and Scikit-learn.
Strong knowledge of image processing and implementation of augmentation techniques.
Very good programming knowledge in Python (including NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib)




This position is open to various experience levels and comes with a competitive salary, fantastic benefits and a clear progression plan.




Apply immediately to find out more!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Junior Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (Cologne)
Company: Zero to One Search | Recruitment Agency
Description:
Junior Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Cologne, hybrid

Contract: Permanent




Are you interested in the next big challenge?

Our client is a big (2k employees in all major cities in Germany) company with several digital products and services on the market that make easier daily life of their customers.

You will find the dynamics of e-commerce, agile processes, flat hierarchies and steep development curves.

Now they are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer with a strong interest in building end-to-end solutions.







Requirements:




Good degree, e.g. in data science, (business) informatics, mathematics, physics or statistics
First practical professional experience in data science projects, preferably with first insights into ranking and recommendation systems
Sound knowledge of the Python data science stack (Pandas, SKLearn, SciPy) as well as experience with deep learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow)
Creativity and curiosity in applying the latest algorithms from the field of data science to optimize their products
Motivation for interdisciplinary work between IT and product management and for knowledge exchange within the company’s Data Science Community
Very good written and spoken German and English skills




Responsibilities:




You are significantly involved in setting up a data science department, automating related business processes and delivering individually tailored results to the customers
You create new machine learning services with a focus on recommendation and ranking systems, information extraction and predictions, including conceptual design, data preparation, model training and evaluation, and subsequent preparation for go-live
You manage your training experiments with modern MLOps frameworks such as MLFlow and help to take the product to the next level
You integrate your models into the product both in terms of content and technology, using cloud technologies (AWS) for example and in close cooperation with the development team
You keep yourself up to date with the latest developments in machine learning and think with your team about how you can use generative AI models such as Transformers or ChatGPT, for example
You work in a cross-disciplinary team in direct cooperation with product managers, developers and business intelligence managers




Benefits:




Flexible working time model with four days per week in the office and one day flexibly from the office or from home.
Personal growth: they support your development with further training and regular feedback meetings to recognize and develop your strengths and potential.
Open-ended contracts with an attractive and performance-oriented salary package including annual bonuses. As well as fitness cooperations, subsidized company bicycle leasing, etc.
Independent, agile work in small teams with a strong team spirit. Short decision-making processes.
An ergonomic workplace with modern equipment, including two additional screens and height-adjustable desks, from your first day at work.

And much more.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join our Global Commercial Organization’s Digital Merchandising team, where you'll drive data-informed strategies to optimize player engagement, acquisition, and merchandising performance across EA APP, Epic, Steam, Nintendo, Xbox, and PlayStation.




As a Data Scientist, you will analyze trends, build and maintain merchandising performance forecasts, provide strategic recommendations, and shape merchandising performance by working independently while collaborating across teams.




Key Responsibilities:

Merchandising Performance Forecasting

Analyze historical data and player trends to develop accurate performance forecasts based on core KPIs.
Oversee forecasting processes, lead reviews, and prepare insights for senior stakeholders.
Collaborate cross-functionally to align objectives and provide actionable reports.

Performance Analysis & Insights

Conduct in-depth analysis of partner channels (traffic, engagement, conversion rates).
Leverage in-game insights to enhance merchandising strategies and player journeys.
Apply attribution models to measure marketing and merchandising impact.
Address gaps in full-journey metrics with actionable insights.

Channel Strategy Optimization

Evaluate and enhance channel-specific merchandising strategies to drive reach, engagement, and conversions.
Leverage A/B testing and player segmentation to maximize performance.

Data Visualization & Storytelling

Transform complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership.
Build compelling reports and dashboards using Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Communicate the impact of merchandising decisions through strong presentation skills.

Advanced Technical & AI Skills

Deep Learning & Predictive Analytics – Leveraging AI-driven insights to enhance merchandising strategies.
NLP & Text Analytics – Analyzing user reviews, in-game behavior, and store feedback for actionable insights.
Big Data Processing – Hands-on experience with Spark, Databricks, or Snowflake for large-scale data analysis.
API Integration & Automation – Utilizing REST APIs, Python scripting, or JavaScript to optimize analytics workflows.

Project Ownership & Innovation

Lead new projects to enhance merchandising performance, identifying opportunities for improvement.
Develop analytics roadmaps, tools, and processes to propel business growth.







Qualifications

5+ years in analytics, focusing on merchandising, channel performance, or marketing in console gaming or digital platforms.
Strong knowledge of Steam, Xbox, and PlayStation storefronts.
Experience mentoring or managing other analysts.
Proven ability to collaborate within a globally diverse organization.
Proficiency in SQL, R Studio, Python, Excel, and Google Sheets.
Expertise in data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience in statistical modelling (e.g., regression, classification) and data engineering (pipelines, blending data sources).
Familiarity with machine learning techniques.
A growth-oriented, proactive mindset with the ability to thrive independently.
Data storytelling & persuasive presentation – Crafting compelling narratives to influence senior leadership.
Agile project management – Experience with JIRA, Confluence, or Scrum for effective project execution. Ownership and end-to-end execution of projects with minimal oversight.
Cross-cultural collaboration – Working efficiently within a globally distributed team with diverse market needs.
Experience with Looker, Airtable, JavaScript for integrating analytics into merchandising workflows represents an advantage.

Show more
HTML:
Join our Global Commercial Organization’s Digital Merchandising team, where you'll drive data-informed strategies to optimize player engagement, acquisition, and merchandising performance across EA APP, Epic, Steam, Nintendo, Xbox, and PlayStation.


As a Data Scientist, you will analyze trends, build and maintain merchandising performance forecasts, provide strategic recommendations, and shape merchandising performance by working independently while collaborating across teams.


Key Responsibilities:

Merchandising Performance Forecasting

  • Analyze historical data and player trends to develop accurate performance forecasts based on core KPIs.
  • Oversee forecasting processes, lead reviews, and prepare insights for senior stakeholders.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to align objectives and provide actionable reports.

Performance Analysis & Insights

  • Conduct in-depth analysis of partner channels (traffic, engagement, conversion rates).
  • Leverage in-game insights to enhance merchandising strategies and player journeys.
  • Apply attribution models to measure marketing and merchandising impact.
  • Address gaps in full-journey metrics with actionable insights.

Channel Strategy Optimization

  • Evaluate and enhance channel-specific merchandising strategies to drive reach, engagement, and conversions.
  • Leverage A/B testing and player segmentation to maximize performance.

Data Visualization & Storytelling

  • Transform complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership.
  • Build compelling reports and dashboards using Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • Communicate the impact of merchandising decisions through strong presentation skills.

Advanced Technical & AI Skills

  • Deep Learning & Predictive Analytics – Leveraging AI-driven insights to enhance merchandising strategies.
  • NLP & Text Analytics – Analyzing user reviews, in-game behavior, and store feedback for actionable insights.
  • Big Data Processing – Hands-on experience with Spark, Databricks, or Snowflake for large-scale data analysis.
  • API Integration & Automation – Utilizing REST APIs, Python scripting, or JavaScript to optimize analytics workflows.

Project Ownership & Innovation

  • Lead new projects to enhance merchandising performance, identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Develop analytics roadmaps, tools, and processes to propel business growth.



Qualifications

  • 5+ years in analytics, focusing on merchandising, channel performance, or marketing in console gaming or digital platforms.
  • Strong knowledge of Steam, Xbox, and PlayStation storefronts.
  • Experience mentoring or managing other analysts.
  • Proven ability to collaborate within a globally diverse organization.
  • Proficiency in SQL, R Studio, Python, Excel, and Google Sheets.
  • Expertise in data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
  • Experience in statistical modelling (e.g., regression, classification) and data engineering (pipelines, blending data sources).
  • Familiarity with machine learning techniques.
  • A growth-oriented, proactive mindset with the ability to thrive independently.
  • Data storytelling & persuasive presentation – Crafting compelling narratives to influence senior leadership.
  • Agile project management – Experience with JIRA, Confluence, or Scrum for effective project execution. Ownership and end-to-end execution of projects with minimal oversight.
  • Cross-cultural collaboration – Working efficiently within a globally distributed team with diverse market needs.
  • Experience with Looker, Airtable, JavaScript for integrating analytics into merchandising workflows represents an advantage.

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer
Description:
MISION:




Estamos buscando un ML engineer para colaborar dentro de nuestro equipo de Big Data y Analítica Avanzada en AXA España, actualmente integrado por Data Scientists y ML Engineers. Buscamos personas con gran solidez técnica que tengan ganas de formar parte de un equipo dinámico e innovador apasionado por el desarrollo de soluciones de IA enfocadas a la generación de valor al negocio.




TAREAS / ACTIVIDADES PRINCIPALES:




Como ML Engineer dentro del equipo de Big Data y Analítica Avanzada, serás el encargado de desarrollar soluciones productivas de ML, IA y GenAI optimizando los recursos disponibles en nuestro stack tecnológico según las especificaciones de cada caso de uso. Serás responsable de definir los requisitos técnicos y de datos necesarios para los casos de uso, implementar la preparación de datos y la modelización y/o el uso de LLMs necesario para darles respuesta y asegurar su puesta en producción siguiendo la metodología MLOps en todas las fases del desarrollo de soluciones de IA. Para asegurar el éxito en el desarrollo de soluciones, necesitarás además:




Trabajar mano a mano con los Data Scientists, arquitectos y desarrolladores software involucrados en el desarrollo de casos de uso de IA.
Colaborar en la definición y el desarrollo del despliegue de la metodología MLOps dentro del equipo.
Estar al tanto de todos los avances en el ámbito de la IA y la metodología MLOps para asegurar que mantenemos nuestros flujos y pipelines de desarrollo y ejecución acordes al estado del arte en cuanto a tecnología y buenas prácticas.




PERFIL:




Cualificaciones necesarias:




Licenciatura en matemáticas, estadística, física o ingeniería en informática, telecomunicación (o similares).
+5 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones software.
Dominio en Python.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos Big Data con Spark/PySpark.
Experiencia en ML, Data Science y desarrollo de soluciones de IA generativa.
Experiencia en el desarrollo y despliegue de soluciones siguiendo la metodología MLOps: productivización de código y generación de librerías, despliegue, gestión y monitorización de modelos y procesos de integración continua.
Inglés: Avanzado




Cualificaciones deseables:




Máster en IA, ML, Data Science o equivalente.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de deep learning y los frameworks asociados (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Experiencia en el uso de frameworks de IA generativa como LangChain o LlamaIndex.
Experiencia en el uso de distintos LLMs tanto propietarios como open source (Llama, OpenAI, Mistral, etc.).
Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones de IA en Microsoft Azure.
Experiencia en el uso de Databricks.




En AXA promovemos activamente la Diversidad e Inclusión ofreciendo igualdad de oportunidades. Se valorará positivamente la posesión de certificado de Discapacidad.







¿A qué estás esperando? ¡Únete a la familia AXA y contribuye al progreso de la sociedad!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team. If you’re reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place.

What are we looking for? People who love technology and, above all, love to learn. And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful. That’s why we’re so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority.

Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you? Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career.

If you’re a Data Scientist and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we’re actively looking for you.

What we’re looking for:


Experience in exploratory data analysis, testing hypotheses, and building predictive models
Strong background in probability theory and statistics, data mining, and machine learning
Experience in Python and Cloud environment
Strong knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL
Fluent in spoken and written English


What we offer:


Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams
Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you
Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings
We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us
Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit
Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ThetaRay:

ThetaRay is a trailblazer in AI-powered Anti-Money Laundering (AML) solutions, offering cutting-edge technology to fintechs, banks, and regulatory bodies worldwide. Our mission is to enhance trust in financial transactions, ensuring compliant and innovative business growth.

Our technology empowers customers to expand into new markets and introduce groundbreaking products.

Thetaray is a culture-driven company. Our values are at the heart of our success. By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to embody these values and inspire others through your actions.

ThetaRay is looking for a Data Scientist for customer-facing projects that combine data science with deep knowledge and understanding of machine learning and big data technologies to create solutions for customers’ challenges and needs, defining and developing appropriate technical and business solutions. The Data Scientist will work closely with ThetaRay’s Product Management, Algorithm, Engineering, and Customer Success teams and lead external partners to successful implementations of the ThetaRay platform and solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Deliver successful deployment and Pilots
Manage and design the Customer-specific technical solution throughout the project life cycle
Technical leadership of Data Science and engineering aspects and team members including partners
Work on various data sources and apply sophisticated feature engineering capabilities
Bring and use business knowledge
Extract insights and actionable recommendations from large volumes of data and Investigate anomalies in Big Data
Build and manage technical relationships with customers and partners
Provide product requirements input to the Product Management team
Train the customers on the system – system usage and monitoring aspects
Travel to customer locations both domestically and abroad




Requirements:

2+ years of experience as a data scientist/data engineer/big-data developer
BSc or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or another related field
Must have proven professional experience in data analytics for financial services with strong data mining and forensic skills
Experience working with customers - an advantage
Must have Hands-on experience and knowledge of scripting languages: Python/PySpark as well as DS workflow management tools including MLflow, Airflow, etc.
Experience in NLP or Graph Algorithms - an advantage
Working experience with Linux OS - an advantage
Fluent English - written and spoken

Core Competencies

Able to solve tech problems for customers; improvise; cope with unexpected challenges
Able to drive relevant internal functions to deliver/solve a problem for customers/partners
A motivated, self-starter who can demonstrate high analytical and technical skills
Ability to design creative solutions for complex requirements
Ability to learn and lead projects independently, and to work with minimal supervision with customers (tech & business)
Strong interpersonal relationship building
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
WHY CHOOSE ENECO?

Eneco has the ambition to lead the energy transition. We excel in the complete chain from energy producing assets to serving customers. This integrated approach connects all Eneco employees and enables us to fulfil our mission. You can feel it throughout the whole organisation, and it leads to multidisciplinary innovations such as Toon, e-Mobility and our Virtual Power Plant.




You are going to work at a company large enough to effect real change, within a digital department that has the flexibility to rival a start-up. Our organization is open and brimming with energy. At Eneco, anyone with a sharp mind and a positive and active mindset can contribute to a more sustainable world.




Create data driven innovations, services, and products for the whole company.




In Eneco’s digital data science team you will set up data-driven solutions together with other business units. This means you can work on a wide variety of topics on the commercial and the operational side of Eneco, as well as the integration between those two. On the commercial side, this can mean advising customers on sustainable investments based on energy use and building characteristics. On the operational side, improving efficiency of district heating or implementing predictive maintenance for wind turbines can be your next subjects. As an integrated energy company, Eneco is also always looking for innovative solutions to integrate supply and demand. In all these projects, adding value both for the customer and for Eneco is key.




Energy companies have large amounts of data available to work with, and Eneco is a leader in this field, for example from our smart thermostat Toon. The big question is: how will you leverage this data? Distributed energy generation and changes in energy demand have upended the conventional market for energy. Digital innovations help to align supply and demand and help the customer have a care-free experience; data plays a crucial part in all this.




YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Identify problems that can be solved using data science and turn those into impactful projects.
Test and develop your ideas through hackathons, prototypes, and pilots all the way up to a working product or service.
Interact with business stakeholders, data analysts, machine learning and data engineers to balance commercial requirements with engineering best practices.
Convey the data science way of working within the organization.
Pragmatic and iterative approach to data science: able to quickly show results to convince the business, rather than wanting to apply the most complex algorithms.




WHAT YOU BRING

You can easily adapt to new environments and situations. You have focus, courage and a “can do” attitude. You use these qualities to obtain the goals that you set for yourself in an ever-changing professional environment.




MSc in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field.
4+ years of experience working as a data scientist within a company.
Knowledge of common data science techniques, NLP techniques and statistical methods.
Strong oral and written presentation skills in English.
An interest in the energy domain and innovations and a curious mindset.
Ability to independently drive data science projects and to inspire and guide more junior data scientists.
Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Azure, MLFlow, AirFlow and Databricks is a plus.




WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFER

A gross salary between €68,000.00 - €97,000.00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.
A free spendable flex budget of 14% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.
Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.
Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.
Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.
Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital products
Help Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035




INTERESTED?

Do you see yourself working as a Data Scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist Junior
Description:
Realnaut es la marca nativa digital del Grupo Axpe Consulting, especializada en diseñar, desarrollar y operar activos digitales en Cloud. Desde su fundación en 2022, hemos colaborado con diversos clientes en más de 20 proyectos, creando experiencias únicas que impulsan el crecimiento empresarial. Nuestro equipo multidisciplinario destaca en áreas como Diseño Digital, Desarrollo, Cloud, DevOps y Big Data, ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras y adaptadas a las necesidades específicas de cada cliente. Comprometidos con la sostenibilidad, la ética y la conciencia, buscamos personas curiosas y con talento disruptivo que compartan nuestra cultura.




En Realnaut somos ágiles, vanguardistas, comprometid@s y techies! Nos apasiona lo que hacemos y tenemos fuertes valores de los que nos sentimos orgullosos. Apostamos por las personas, la formación y la innovación tecnológica. Con nosotros vas a encontrar un equipo altamente especializado, profesional y que te va a apoyar para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales y personales.




Para cumplir con el plan de crecimiento de la marca estamos buscando un Data Scientist Junior con conocimientos en Power BI y SQL Server, y experiencia en modelos predictivos y de regresión.




Funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y optimizar modelos predictivos y de regresión para distintos proyectos.
Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights accionables.
Desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
Gestionar bases de datos en SQL Server para el almacenamiento y procesamiento de datos.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para definir estrategias basadas en datos.




Requisitos:

Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática o afines.
Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL Server.
Experiencia en la implementación de modelos predictivos y de regresión.
Habilidad para interpretar y comunicar resultados de análisis de datos.




Valoramos:

Conocimientos y certificaciones en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).
Experiencia en lenguajes como Python o R.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y proactividad.




Ofrecemos:

Incorporación a una empresa moderna, en continuo crecimiento, donde vas a disfrutar trabajando y tendrás todas las facilidades para desarrollar tu potencial.
Integrarte a un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados, con un magnífico clima laboral, innovador y dinámico que van a apoyarte para conseguir tus objetivos.
Plan de formación continuo.
Conciliación familiar y teletrabajo.
Retribución muy competitiva compuesta de: fijo, retribución flexible y seguro médico.




Si piensas que cubres los requisitos, no dudes en enviarnos tu CV, ¡estamos deseando conocerte!

HTML:
Realnaut es la marca nativa digital del Grupo Axpe Consulting, especializada en diseñar, desarrollar y operar activos digitales en Cloud. Desde su fundación en 2022, hemos colaborado con diversos clientes en más de 20 proyectos, creando experiencias únicas que impulsan el crecimiento empresarial. Nuestro equipo multidisciplinario destaca en áreas como Diseño Digital, Desarrollo, Cloud, DevOps y Big Data, ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras y adaptadas a las necesidades específicas de cada cliente. Comprometidos con la sostenibilidad, la ética y la conciencia, buscamos personas curiosas y con talento disruptivo que compartan nuestra cultura.


En Realnaut somos ágiles, vanguardistas, comprometid@s y techies! Nos apasiona lo que hacemos y tenemos fuertes valores de los que nos sentimos orgullosos. Apostamos por las personas, la formación y la innovación tecnológica. Con nosotros vas a encontrar un equipo altamente especializado, profesional y que te va a apoyar para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales y personales.


Para cumplir con el plan de crecimiento de la marca estamos buscando un Data Scientist Junior con conocimientos en Power BI y SQL Server, y experiencia en modelos predictivos y de regresión.


Funciones:

  • Diseñar, desarrollar y optimizar modelos predictivos y de regresión para distintos proyectos.
  • Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights accionables.
  • Desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
  • Gestionar bases de datos en SQL Server para el almacenamiento y procesamiento de datos.
  • Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para definir estrategias basadas en datos.


Requisitos:

  • Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática o afines.
  • Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL Server.
  • Experiencia en la implementación de modelos predictivos y de regresión.
  • Habilidad para interpretar y comunicar resultados de análisis de datos.


Valoramos:

  • Conocimientos y certificaciones en Cloud (AWS, Azure o GCP).
  • Experiencia en lenguajes como Python o R.
  • Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y proactividad.


Ofrecemos:

  • Incorporación a una empresa moderna, en continuo crecimiento, donde vas a disfrutar trabajando y tendrás todas las facilidades para desarrollar tu potencial.
  • Integrarte a un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados, con un magnífico clima laboral, innovador y dinámico que van a apoyarte para conseguir tus objetivos.
  • Plan de formación continuo.
  • Conciliación familiar y teletrabajo.
  • Retribución muy competitiva compuesta de: fijo, retribución flexible y seguro médico.


Si piensas que cubres los requisitos, no dudes en enviarnos tu CV, ¡estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.




We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.




With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




What you will do:

Neotalent is looking for a Data Scientist to join one of the largest software houses based in Lisbon focus on e-sourcing and e-procurement solutions.




As we continue to spearhead digital transformation initiatives, we take pride in introducing cutting-edge AI products that are revolutionizing procurement processes.

Develop custom data models and algorithms using advanced machine learning tools and statistical techniques.
Utilize programming languages like R and Python to conduct comprehensive analysis and modeling.
Apply expertise in statistical analysis and predictive modeling to extract actionable insights from data.
Identify hidden patterns and insights within data to facilitate informed decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement workflows for data extraction, transformation, and loading from diverse sources.
Ensure the integrity and security of data throughout the entire process.




Are you ready for a leap in your career?




What you are like:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist;
Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in real world settings;
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, coupled with hands-on expertise;
Exceptional problem-solving abilities, enabling effective translation of business requirements into technical solutions.
Professional english proficiency (written and spoken);




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!
